channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on June 4
Trans-Cab fleet halved since arrival of private-hire firms
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Trans-Cab, the second-largest taxi operator here, bore the brunt of a fleet shrinkage brought about by the arrival of private-hire operators.

item.title: New council to create jobs on unprecedented scale
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

The new National Jobs Council will work in the coming months to grow jobs and training opportunities on a much greater scale than anything attempted before, said its chairman, Senior Minister Tharman Shanmugaratnam, yesterday.

item.title: Appointments made to Council of Presidential Advisers
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

President Halimah Yacob has reappointed Mr Eddie Teo as chairman of the Council of Presidential Advisers (CPA) for a six-year term.

item.title: Experts warn of hidden reservoirs of coronavirus infections in Singapore
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Six out of the seven new community cases announced yesterday were asymptomatic.

item.title: CJ on ensuring justice in the time of Covid-19
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Chief Justice Sundaresh Menon has flagged a situation of "real concern" that has arisen following the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: 80 breaches found at purpose-built dorms annually in past 3 years
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

About 80 breaches have been found every year - over the past three years - at purpose-built dormitories, although the majority were for minor lapses, said the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) yesterday.

item.title: 5 people sentenced over separate offences linked to Covid-19 outbreak
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

A sex worker breached safe distancing measures and allowed a regular customer to enter her home during the circuit breaker period.

item.title: No one is too old to hire, too qualified to adapt: Tharman
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

No employer should think someone is too old to hire, or that those with higher skills are overqualified or not adaptable enough, Senior Minister Tharman Shanmugaratnam said yesterday, in a Facebook post on the jobs challenge for Singapore amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Vouchers for low-income families in Hong Kah North
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Some 300 low-income families in Hong Kah North whose finances have been affected by the Covid-19 pandemic will receive monthly vouchers worth $50 for the next three months that they can use to purchase supplies and services such as haircuts.

item.title: Drive-through Covid-19 swab test facility launched at One Farrer Hotel
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Gleneagles, Mount Elizabeth and Parkway East hospitals had also been trialled for the installation of drive-throughs.

item.title: Singapore to resume essential business travel with China
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

More planes are set to take flight, with Singapore agreeing to resume essential business and official travel with China and exploring similar "fast lane" arrangements with a few other countries and regions.

item.title: Dengue outbreak threatens to be biggest yet
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore may face the biggest dengue outbreak ever, warns the National Environment Agency (NEA), "unless collective community action is taken".

item.title: 3 workplaces told to shut for insisting staff return to office
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Three workplaces were forced to stop operations for failing to implement adequate safe management measures, including instructing employees to return to the office instead of allowing them to work from home, said the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) yesterday evening.

item.title: Former managing director jailed over crowdfunding for SMEs without licence
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

A former managing director of a company is the first person to be sent to jail for using crowdfunding to secure monies for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) despite not having a licence to do so.

item.title: Employers who abuse Jobs Support Scheme face fines, jail: Taxman
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

The taxman has warned employers who abuse the Jobs Support Scheme (JSS) to obtain higher payouts that they would be charged under the Penal Code and face up to 10 years' imprisonment and a fine.

item.title: Dentist jailed for making false Chas claims
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

A 36-year-old dentist yesterday became the first person to be jailed for cheating the Government through the Community Health Assist Scheme (Chas).

item.title: Coronavirus: Rental waivers, wage subsidies help F&B group stay afloat
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

It has been a year of both highs and lows for Mr Indra Kantono.

item.title: Bedok Police Division named best land division
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

From arresting a mother who abandoned her baby in a rubbish chute, to nabbing a suspect who drove against traffic to evade capture, police officers from the Bedok Police Division have solved several high-profile cases over the past year.

item.title: Over 5,400 suspended home renovation projects get nod for restart
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 5,400 suspended home renovation projects received approval to resume works on Tuesday, said the Building and Construction Authority (BCA) yesterday.

item.title: Ex-Hyflux subsidiary employee faces corruption charges
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

A former human resource manager of a Hyflux subsidiary was charged with corruption yesterday.

item.title: Labour veteran receives highest May Day award
item.description:
June 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Labour veteran Koh Juan Kiat has received the Distinguished Service Award, the highest accolade in this year's May Day Awards.
